name: Virtual Haken conjecture
rephrased: Every 'simple' three-dimensional shape (compact, orientable, irreducible) with an infinite number of distinct loops (infinite fundamental group) has a finite covering space that itself has a specific type of structure (is a Haken manifold).
implication_form: If a compact, orientable, irreducible three-dimensional manifold has an infinite fundamental group, then it is virtually Haken.
solved_by: Grigori Perelman (and others) proved the conjecture for hyperbolic 3-manifolds as a consequence of the Geometrization conjecture, leaving the conjecture fully solved.
explained: The Virtual Haken Conjecture states that every compact, orientable, irreducible three-dimensional manifold with an infinite fundamental group is virtually Haken. This means that such a manifold has a finite cover (a covering space with a finite-to-one covering map) that is a Haken manifold. A Haken manifold is a compact, orientable, irreducible three-manifold that contains an incompressible two-dimensional topological surface (such as a properly embedded disk, sphere, or annulus).
